Copper, brass and aluminium are separated and remelted for reuse.
sentence.Network_cn: 铜、黄铜和铝被分门别类重新熔化以进行再利用。

entry.def: Someone who is separated from their wife or husband lives apart from them, but is not divorced.

example.ex: Most single parents are either divorced or separated...
example.tran: 大多数单身父母要么离婚了要么分居了。

example.ex: Tristan had been separated from his wife for two years.
example.tran: 特里斯坦和妻子已经分居两年了。

entry.tran: (与家人等)分离的，不在一起的
entry.def: If you are separated from someone, for example your family, you are not able to be with them.

example.ex: The idea of being separated from him, even for a few hours, was torture...
example.tran: 一想到要和他分开，即便是短短几小时，都感到备受煎熬。

example.ex: They're trying their best to bring together those separated families.
example.tran: 他们正尽最大的努力让离散的家人重聚。

means.word_mean: 1. being or feeling set or kept apart from others;

sentences.sentence: "could not remain the isolated figure he had been"- Sherwood Anderson
"thought of herself as alone and separated from the others"

means.word_mean: 3. not living together as man and wife;

sentences.sentence: "on one side of the island was a hugh rock, almost detached"
"the separated spacecraft will return to their home bases"

Sentence.sentence: In the second stage, Doctor Bastian separated the dolphins into two tanks.
After all, more than 200 years separated Einstein from his nearest rival, Isaac Newton.
